benchmark_details.name: EEmo-Bench: A Benchmark for Multi-modal Large Language Models on Image Evoked Emotion Assessment
benchmark_details.overview: EEmo-Bench is a benchmark dedicated to analyzing evoked emotions in images across diverse content categories, using a systematic evaluation framework that includes tasks such as Perception, Ranking, Description, and Assessment.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To comprehensively evaluate the image-evoked emotions perception and understanding capabilities of multi-modal large language models (MLLMs).

data.source: Images collected from Flickr, manually annotated by participants covering various emotional attributes including ranking and Valence-Arousal-Dominance (VAD) scores.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are computed using the ranking scores and evaluation results from subjective human annotators.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in perceiving and ranking the emotions evoked by images.
methodology.validation: Conducted through multiple annotation rounds and a consistency checks.
